name: Transaction Processing and Management
description: Manages the complete lifecycle of credit card transactions including inquiry, creation, posting, interest calculation, and reporting.

name: Credit Card Management
description: Provides comprehensive credit card lifecycle management including card inquiry, selection, updates, and maintenance operations.

name: Account Management
description: Handles customer account operations including account inquiry, updates, balance management, and account-card relationship management.

name: Authorization Processing
description: Manages credit card authorization requests including real-time processing, fraud detection, pending authorization management, and IMS/DB2 integration.

name: Customer Service and Payments
description: Provides customer-facing services including bill payment processing and account balance management.

name: User Administration and Security
description: Manages user accounts, authentication, role-based access control, and security for the card management system.

name: Reporting and Analytics
description: Generates business reports, customer statements, and analytical outputs in multiple formats for management and customer communication.

name: System Navigation and Interface
description: Provides main menu systems, navigation interfaces, and date/time services for user access to application functions.

name: Data Management and File Operations
description: Manages data files, performs data extraction, loading, export/import operations, and maintains data integrity across the system.

name: Reference Data Management
description: Maintains master reference data including transaction types, categories, disclosure groups, and lookup tables used throughout the system.

name: System Administration and Infrastructure
description: Provides system administration, database management, file infrastructure, CICS operations, build procedures, and technical support operations.

name: Shared Services
description: Provides common utility functions, date handling, DB2 communication wrappers, messaging, and reusable components used across multiple business domains.
